entry.def: A congress is a large meeting that is held to discuss ideas and policies.

sentences.cn: 从9月到12月，国会一直都在开会。
sentences.en: From September until December, Congress remained in session.

Sentence.sentence: America will remain the best place on earth to do business, so long as Barack Obama and the Democrats in Congress resist the temptation to interfere too much, and so long as organised labour does not overplay its hand.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In 1944, Congress passed a bill to upgrade the system, but did not fund the plan right away.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In 2012, 125 students at Harvard were caught up in a scandal when it was discovered they had cheated on a take-home exam for a class entitled "Introduction To Congress".
Sentence.come: 2017年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Over $25 billion was appropriated by Congress, and construction began on about 40,000 miles of new roads.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section C
